My Personal Review - BioShock Infinite (2013) From BioShock Collection (2016)

My Rating: 8.4/10

Sometimes there is a game that focuses on the story and character writing rather than it's gameplay mechanics, BioShock Infinite is one of them. This game doesn't shine on it's combat or gameplay mechanics but it shines through it's story and it's world lore, in that aspect i think this game did really well in fact probably even better than the previous games. Character writing are so interesting on this, especially Elizabeth herself, the protagonist Booker himself and Luteces Twins. 

Story is really good as well and very interesting but it might not be for everyone because it focuses on Multiverse Hypothesis concept which to it's own is a very confusing subject. As for myself i personally love a story that revolves around that certain subject. Which the main reason why i love the main story of this game so much.
Character development is really well done as well. Throughout the game you can see how Elizabeth's character changes from being a innocent naive girl from the tower to a very complex emotionally driven woman that seeks answers.

Now to the downsides.

The gameplay mechanics. I think the gameplay of BioShock Infinite is a downgrade compared to the previous games. Almost all the good things from the previous games gameplay mechanics was stripped off on this game such as the stealth mechanics, research camera, and reduced perks and weapons which is limited to only 2 at a time. Which is very frustrating in my opinion. All this just to make it more simpler and appeal to the modern standards of generic FPS games nowadays. 

For some people, especially the one who hasn't played the previous games or didn't liked the previous games gameplay mechanics. This might not be a problem for them. Heck it wasn't even a problem for me back when i played Infinite for the first time on 2013. 

But now since i have already played the previous games and genuniely enjoyed their gameplay mechanics, it is a problem for me now. and I had more fun with BioShock 2 when it comes to gameplay compared to Infinite which i found more boring and duller nowadays. But hey at least it's not terrible and clunky like the way BioShock 1 felt with it's outdated gunplay mechanics.

Also the enemy waves on this game feels a lot different compared to previous games. It feels more generic like the one found in Call of Duty games and other modern FPS games, which makes it feel not as unique and not even close compared to previous games like BioShock 2 where you have a choice to tactically take splicers down with  many traps, and using the environment when you are about to gather adam from a corpse with your little sister. 

In BioShock Infinite it's just a lot of enemy waves and run and gun shoot and kill. No option to tactically take them down by stealth and you can't even use the environment for your advantage for a longer time because you can't permanently hack a turret. Previous games wasn't like this at all and they felt more of a immersive sim compared to BioShock Infinite's more generic modern FPS approach.

But despite with all those flaws. I honestly can say that i still love this game mainly because of it's story and it's world lore. It just feels really well crafted with pure passion and love, and the story and character development is really well done and it's very unique, very few games even dare to tackle the subject of multiverse hypothesis on their games, let alone use them as the main subject on the plot of their games. And for that i like this game even more. It's just that it falls apart when it comes to gameplay mechanics, but just like what i said, if you haven't played the previous games or are not a fan of their gameplay mechanics. Then this certain problem won't affect your experience.

And by the time i have made this review i have recently finished my 5th playthrough of this game.

Pros:

- Great Story.
- Great Character Development.
- Well Written Characters.
- Great Atmosphere on it's world introduction.
- Really Unique World Design and it's Lore.
- Decent soundtrack.
- Great Twist Ending.
- Interesting encounters.

Cons:

- Gameplay Mechanics watered down to appeal on wider audience.
- There is no consequences on the choice you make throughout the game.
- You can only use 2 guns at the same time which is very frustrating.
- Limited perks especially when compared to previous games.
- The Ghost fight felt really frustrating and really hard.
- Level Design not as good compared to BioShock 1.

Rating On Each Aspect:

- Story: 9/10
- Gameplay: 6/10
- Atmosphere: 9/10
- Soundtrack: 8/10
- Voice Acting: 8.5/10
- World: 8.5/10
- Dialogue: 8.5/10
- Content: 9/10 - Basing Off Bioshock Collection's With The All DLCs Included.

[h1] Compelling story with beautiful graphic [/h1]

BioShock Infinte let's the player to roam in the city of Columbia, a city that floats above the sky. It succesfully combine the futuristic theme around the town with the American's 1900's feels.

While you on a mission to grab a girl from the city and get the hell out from Columbia, soon you will discover the city's secret one by one, and that is what make this game's story interesting. Every secrets you discovered, you're always keeps thinking "Is there more?", and soon you'll fine yourself overwhelmed by the answer that you dyingly seeked.

The gameplay itself is pretty fun, where you could went hellblazing with your choice of weapon, like RPG or a Crank Gun, or you could went nuts with your "superpower" like sent your enemies floating in air, or sent a horde of crows flying into your enemies. There's so much things to do, you could never get bored.

Stands up well even by todays standards, the zip line fighting is awesome, not at all like the other bioshocks

Gameplay is a reskinned bioshock with some changes. The game only allows you to carry 2 guns, but due to the poor balancing between the weapons, you more or less use the same 2 the whole game. Enemies have poor AI, and each encounter feels the exact same but in a different area. 

Story-wise the game starts off pretty strong, but then later attempts to masquerade as some intelligent narrative that in reality is just a huge mess. Most of the time it feels like the developers wrote themselves into a corner and had to use plot devices to keep the story going.

The original bioshock games presented themes that questioned many aspects of human nature, politics and society. This game however, tries to but gets lost in its bloated and overdone story.

The game is okay at best, if you expect anything close to the level of exceptionality of the original bioshock, this game does not even come close. However, the burial at sea episodes are worth a look at if on sale. Even if the episodes bring the annoying plot devices to the original game and setting.
Great game, highly recommend. 8/10

BioShock tricks you, it looks and behaves as a great game, but it is not that "great".


I will try to explain myself, so first of all it is First-Person Shooter and probably you know what  John Carmack says about FPS - good scenario is OK, but it is not the required element. Game has a very good scenario and a way it is presented to the player: cut scenes, tapes, videos, atmosphere(I love the early 19xx), flashbacks. Basically, it is like a video novel and this part is done in a very good way.

On opposite side, action part is miserable. The interesting world of cloud city looks like railway, room following by room, sometimes U-turn and same room again. You can not move forward without defeating enemies in the room you have to shout them - no stealth, no 'other' way, just shoot. Hero has two weapon and two spells at a time and the lady, which gives you supplies. And the the thing allowing you to move on railways.

And no challenge(you have can respawn multiply times, no way to to kill you), enemies are stupid, easily defeated from distance, but when near you are deadly. So you should respawn and kill them from distance. Weapons are the same, I mean you see different animation, but damage and effect is almost the same. As example, you can carry 50 bullets for pistol, they do same damage as 5 RPG charges(max you can carry). If you have a long fight, you have to drop weapon without bullets and pick next, which have them. And shoot. Spells are same too, lighting  disables enemies, antigravity disables enemies, domination disables, crows disables....No sense to change spells, just pick up the cheapest one and use  it. 

Railway system - Argh, look pretty first time,  but on 'Hard' enemies can hit you without issue. They will hit you less, even you just standing without moving.

Girl behaves herself like a lady, gives you health and mana. Can show weapon racks sometimes(cool solution, I agree). But she doesn't help, restoring 5 bullets is not going to help you. Healing 1/5 of your health too.

Playing and fighting is not challenging, you can die 100 times for one battle and feel the same as you do it without dying. 

My recommendation is put 'Easy' and play like a video novel. Cake is a lie.

I've never played the original 2 Bioshock games, but even I can tell that this game is a masterpiece and deserves all the glory it gets. 

The combat can seem a bit chaotic sometimes, and the earlygame heavy enemies are a real pain in the ass, but other than that it's fine. It's not too focussed on the combat, it's more focussed on the story. 
It's possible, a FPS with a good story, and good might just be an understatement. I got some spoilers while playing the game, which revealed some major plotpoints of the ending, but I was still blown away by everything that went down.

Also played the DLCs, totally worth the money, great addition to the story, linking it with the first two games. Practically a must buy, especially if you've also played the first two.

Este juego mucha gente se queja de que es muy malo por su jugabilidad, estos mismos no se fijan en lo mejor de todo que es:
-Su historia.
-Y sus personajes
Y otra cosa que yo, subjetivamente, valoro mucho es el realismo de los personajes; me crei todos y cada uno de los dialogos de los protagonistas, haciendolos mas humanos, no simples personajes ficticios.
Los graficos aunque no sean muy buenos, eljuego me parece precioso en su apartado artistico.
La evoluciÃ³n de Elisabeth como persona me parece que esta hecha de una forma maravillosa, al igual que el avance de la relacion entre los dos protagonistas.
La musica es otro apartado que resulta excepcional por lo bonita que es y por que la mejor banda sonora es la que te ayuda a sentir las emociones del momento (en mi opiniÃ³n), tanto para hacerte llorar como para hacerte sentir espectacular.
La ambientacion tambien me parece un punto a favor, aunque prefiero rapture del bioshock original.
y con los DLCs de PanteÃ³n marino parte 1 y 2, no encuentro forma mejor para acabar la saga de forma perfecta.
mi valoraciÃ³n es de un 9,99/10, ya que por ejemplo no me gusta que no haya mapa y la batalla final me parece un poco frustrante, pero esto no me impide que lo valore desde mi punto de vista como una obra maestra que se deberia jugar.
